div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 07:35 am CDT

div.div: Scattered showers, with thunderstorms also possible after 1pm. Cloudy, with a high near 63. East wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
Scattered showers before 10pm, then a chance of rain, mainly between 10pm and 1am. Cloudy, with a low around 45. Northeast wind 10 to 15 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.
A 20 percent chance of showers before 1pm. Cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly sunny, with a high near 62. North wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

div.font: No School for remainder of 2019-2020 school year

div.p:
Keota Eagle Family,
Governor Kim Reynolds announced that all schools in Iowa will remain closed through the end of the school year to help prevent the further spread of COVID-19 on April 17, 2020.

div.p:
The Keota Bowl was lit tonight (4.10.20) for 15 minutes tonight, symbolizing the 15 days of school we've missed.
This will happen across the state for next two Fridays. Go Eagles!
